subject: RE: [junit] Please Help :: JUint Tests Stop at Error
msgSnippet: I have received a similar error (NoClassDefFound) with competing Class names. Make sure you do not define kiwi.jar twice (or that the specific Class is not
messageBody:
I have received a similar error (NoClassDefFound) with competing Class
names. Make sure you do not define kiwi.jar twice (or that the specific
Class is not defined twice in your CLASSPATH).

Additionally, you may want to place your test's source code in your
emails (just in case).

_____

From: shihab [mailto:shihab_kb@...]
Sent: Monday, April 12, 2004 10:48 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Please Help :: JUint Tests Stop at Error


Help :: JUint Tests Stop at Error

The application build still works, but unfortunately the JUnit tests
always end with
an error. The error occurs immediately, but the build process still
continues. We really need the JUnit tests to work so we can
benchmark the
tests on Windows and the OS/400. Here's the error I receive when
building
the JUnit tests:

[junit] Running com.comp.org.data.test.TestMain
[junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec
[junit] TEST com.comp.org.data.test.TestMain FAILED

This is the error message that the JUnit Report produces:

java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39
)
at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl
.java:25)
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: kiwi/ui/model/ITreeNode
at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:141)
at com.comp.org.data.test.TestMain.class$(Unknown Source)
at com.comp.org.data.test.TestMain.suite(Unknown Source)
... 22 more

I tried copying the kiwi.jar file to a separate directory and setting
the
CLASSPATH to point to the absolute path of this file, but I still get
the
same error.
